title: [BUG] RowToColumnar codegen falls over at 2575 longs
body:
**Describe the bug**
I gen a codegen error if I try to do a simple test with 2575 columns of long values.

```
Caused by: org.codehaus.janino.InternalCompilerException: failed to compile: org.codehaus.janino.InternalCompilerException: Compiling "GeneratedClass" in "generated.java": Code of method "copyInto$(Lorg/apache/spark/sql/catalyst/expressions/GeneratedClass$SpecificInternalRowToColumnarBatchIterator;Lorg/apache/spark/sql/catalyst/expressions/UnsafeRow;JJ)I" of class "org.apache.spark.sql.catalyst.expressions.GeneratedClass$SpecificInternalRowToColumnarBatchIterator" grows beyond 64 KB
...
  at org.apache.spark.sql.catalyst.expressions.codegen.CodeGenerator$.compile(CodeGenerator.scala:1437)
  at com.nvidia.spark.rapids.GeneratedInternalRowToCudfRowIterator$.apply(GpuRowToColumnarExec.scala:852)
  at com.nvidia.spark.rapids.GpuRowToColumnarExec.$anonfun$internalDoExecuteColumnar$1(GpuRowToColumnarExec.scala:910)
```

**Steps/Code to reproduce bug**

```
val schema = (1 to 10000).map(n => s"col_$n long").mkString(",")
spark.time(DBGen().addTable("data", schema, 10000).toDF(spark).selectExpr((1 to 2575).map(n => s"COUNT(col_$n)"): _*).show())
```

On the CPU I was able to do 400,000 columns and stopped after it was taking over 80 GiB of heap for it to work.

**Expected behavior**
I would like the GPU code to not fall over when there are lots of long columns. Instead fall back to something less ideal/performant.
